column8: he lived in elizabeth for most of his life. henry was a marine corps veteran of the vietnam war
column9: lance corporal with india battery 3rd battalion. mr. napier was employed by merck & co. in rahway for 25 years as chemical operator. henry is survived by his wife nadejda napier
column13: joseph magiera and his wife theresa
column14: sister elaine napier-pearson and her husband robert. he was predeceased by his brother edward magiera
column15: sister rose kobovitch and brother-in-law edward kobovitch. also survived by 33 nieces and 36 nephews
column16: great nieces and nephews and great great nieces and nephews. we will always love you uncle wu. relatives and friends are kindly invited to attend a memorial service on saturday
column19: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm at krowicki mc. cracken funeral home 2124 east st. georges ave. linden
column21: donations in his memory to the wounded warrior project
